security_audit.summary: This official skill provides guidance, templates, and validation scripts for agent files. No unsafe behaviors or sensitive operations are introduced.

content.user_title: Build autonomous agents for Claude Code
content.value_statement: You need a reliable structure for creating autonomous agents with clear triggers and system prompts. This skill gives templates, rules, and validation steps to build them correctly.
actual_capabilities: Provides a complete agent file format with required frontmatter fields
Defines trigger description patterns with example blocks and commentary
Supplies system prompt templates and quality standards for agents
Includes a shell script to validate agent files for structure and rules
Shows full agent examples for review, tests, docs, and security use
limitations: Does not create agent files automatically
Validation script only checks a single file path at a time
Guidance targets Claude Code plugin agents, not other platforms
No runtime testing or execution of agent behavior

use_cases.title: Create a new agent
use_cases.description: Design an agent with clear triggers, tools, and system prompt structure for a Claude Code plugin.

use_cases.title: Standardize agents
use_cases.description: Align multiple agents to the same frontmatter rules and prompt quality standards.

use_cases.title: Document agents
use_cases.description: Generate consistent documentation for when and how agents should be triggered.

prompt_templates.title: Define agent basics
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a simple agent layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the required frontmatter fields and a minimal agent example for a Claude Code plugin.

prompt_templates.title: Triggering examples
prompt_templates.prompt: Create three <example> blocks for an agent that reviews recently written code. Include context, commentary, and agent invocation.

prompt_templates.title: System prompt plan
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a strong system prompt
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a system prompt for a test generation agent with responsibilities, process steps, output format, and edge cases.

prompt_templates.title: Full agent spec
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a complete agent file
prompt_templates.prompt: Produce a full agent markdown file for a security analyzer agent, including name, description with examples, model, color, tools, and system prompt.

output_examples.input: Give me a checklist for validating a new agent file.
output: Check YAML frontmatter starts and ends with triple dashes
Verify required fields: name, description, model, color
Confirm description includes triggering examples with commentary
Ensure system prompt is second person and has clear steps

best_practices: Include 2 to 4 triggering examples with clear commentary
Limit tools to the minimum needed for the agent
Define output format and edge cases in the system prompt
anti_patterns: Granting full tool access without need

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code plugins?
faq.answer: Yes. It is written specifically for Claude Code plugin agents and their file structure.

faq.question: Are there limits on agent description length?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance recommends 10 to 5000 characters, with 200 to 1000 preferred.

faq.question: How do I integrate this into my plugin workflow?
faq.answer: Create agents in your plugin agents directory and validate them with the provided script.

faq.question: Does this skill send data outside my environment?
faq.answer: No. It contains local documentation and a local validation script only.

faq.question: What should I do if triggering is unreliable?
faq.answer: Add more examples with varied phrasing and clarify commentary on when to trigger.

faq.question: How does this compare to writing agents manually?
faq.answer: It provides structured templates and rules so manual creation is faster and more consistent.
